result.execSummary:
The defendant Pamela Ann Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY.  IID for a period of 2 yrs to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.

miscConds.notes: jail committment may be imposed if fines and costs are not paid in full by due date.

No possession or consumption of any alcohol. 
Not to be present in any bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Provide DNA sample.
Follow any correctional program as deemed appropriate.
Court directs DOC to have Defendant assessed for Drug Court Program.
If Defendant follows through with process and is denied, Court may consider whether 3 months jail should be stayed or not.
Must pay supervision fees.
Not to operate a motor vehicel without a valid license.
jail commitment may be imposed if fine is not paid in full by due date.

timeConds.notes: Court orders 9 months jail time. 3 months stayed pending further order of the court.

2:49  Defendant Pamela Ann Wood in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Pamela Ann Wood in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Helgeson addresses - defendant will be released on Wed. and the stay remains in effect until the OWI court is put in place or pending further order of the court.
from Atty Helgeson re: Defendant's release date and requesting a hearing on stayed three monthy sentencing pending OWI Court.
from Pam Wood re: good time and DWI program.
from Pam Wood re: New DWI program and good time for jail.
Approved.  Copy given to the defendant in PCJ.

11:40 Defendant Pamela Ann Wood in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Pamela Ann Wood in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses letter sent by defendant regarding sentencing.  Def. not admitted to drug court program.  Court currently not ready to address sentence at this time.  Court will keep 3 months stayed time pending upon completion of new program, OWI court, if program is not established by the time defendant completes 6 months in jail, court will address the 3 months stayed time at a later date.  3 months is still stayed at this time.  Defendant will be notified if and when the program is established. 11:46
from Pam Wood re: amount of jail time, 9 months was stayed pending application to Drug Court.
of Attorney Fees with itemized billing attached.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Pamela Ann Wood in Court with Attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  ADA William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 2:04 p.m.  Court confirms Attorneys received PSI, reviews recommendations.  ADA Thorie makes statement and recommendations, notes fine as well as Drug Court recommendation.  Atty. Helgeson joins in State's recommendation.  Court explains Drug Court.  Defendant makes statement.  Attorneys and Court discuss options.  Court sentences Defendant, W/H.  Three years Probation.  Conditions of Probation include:  No use, possession or consumption of alcohol.  Not to be present in bars, taverns or liquor stores.  Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Follow any correctional program as deemed appropriate.  Court directs DOC to have Defendant assessed for Drug Court Program.  Court imposes 9 months in Pierce County Jail, three months stayed pending successful completion of Pierce County Drug Court program.  If Defendant follows through with process and is denied Court may consider whether three months should be stayed or not.  Must pay Supervision fees.  Three year license revocation.  Not to operate a motor vehicle w/o a valid license.  Any vehicles Defendant owns or operates must have IID for 3 years.  Pay $1744 fine. 3 years to pay fine and court costs.  Defendant to commence Jail today.  Court advises of appeal rights.  Cannot vote.  Not to possess a firearm.
Copy given to DA and Atty Helgeson

9:43 Defendant Pamela Ann Wood in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: files a second amended information. Def will plead guilty to charge of 6th. Requests a PSI. Helgeson and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant . Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to charge contained in the second amended information; Helgeson stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to charge contained in the second amended information. Orders a PSI. Court goes over bond conditions with Def. Bond remains in it's current form and amount.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Same appearances as WOPH.  ADA Thorie presents Court with Information and advises that Count Two has been added, BAC charge.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands.  Atty. Helgeson waives further reading.  Defendant pleads NG on Counts One-Two.  Court reiterate conditions of bond.
